plugins.name: Font Theme
plugins.description: Not all fonts that go well together match the theme of your design. This AI powered plugin lets you describe your design and its intended audience and then suggests font pairs that match the theme you entered. You can also simply just type in the vibe or feeling you want the font to evoke.The best part? You can save the fonts and all their weights as text styles in your Figma with the click of a button!The text styles will save the font weights as numbers because that's how developers code font weights. This will ease the communication with your developers because you'll get familiar with how they refer to font weights.
plugins.tagline: Search for font pairs to match the feeling of your design.

122088.name: Font Theme
122088.description: Not all fonts that go well together match the theme of your design. 122088.release_notes: Now creates matches from all Figma fonts compared to only Google fonts in the previous version.
122088.tagline: Search for font pairs to match the feeling of your design.

plugins.name: Side note
plugins.description: Meet Side Note, your minimalist companion for organizing thoughts, ideas, and to-dos in style. Side Note is designed for simplicity, focus, and seamless integration with your creative workflow. Whether you're jotting down quick ideas or capturing important notes, Side Note keeps everything neat and accessible.Key Features:Customizable Notes: Add titles, content, and importance labels to make each note unique.Smart Sizing: Flexible vertical layouts with precise padding for a polished design.Intuitive Interface: Clean, modern UI for a distraction-free note-taking experience.Important Labeling: Highlight key notes with an elegant "Important" tag for quick prioritization.Effortless Integration: Built for seamless use within Figma, perfect for designers on the go.

plugins.name: Figma Variable to Code
plugins.description: This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.Load the variable collectionsChoose the collection you want to generate variables forPaste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting listClick generateCopy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebaseNote: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
plugins.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

122624.name: Figma Variable to Code
122624.description: This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.Load the variable collectionsChoose the collection you want to generate variables forPaste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting listClick generateCopy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebaseNote: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
122624.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

plugins.name: Jam Session
plugins.description: Jam Session lets you run inclusive activities in FigJam.Start a session as a facilitator and let anybody join by sharing a QR code, unique link or session code. Take control of hybrid or in-person workshop facilities and make sure everyone can inclusively participate.Learn more at www.jamsesh.xyzHow to useStart a session with the plugin. Set a timer, an activity prompt, and how you want notes to appear on the board.Share the QR code or a link with participants. Anybody can join your session on any device through our companion web-app.Watch submissions roll in. Wait until the timer finishes or end the session early. Affinity map, synth or destroy the results as you please.Whether you're running an in-person workshop with a FigJam board as the source of truth, or doing something hybrid and just want to ensure everyone can contribute, Jam Session is the tool you never knew you needed.Keeps the fun alive in workshopsAvoids firewall or laggy machine issues for diverse participantsGives you control of how submissions appearJam Session is in public beta.A FigJam plugin with this many moving parts may have rough edges. If you find something weird or didn't work, please don't hesitate to reach out to the support email and we'll get right on it.

plugins.name: Modyo Figma Plugin
plugins.description: The Modyo Figma Plugin is an essential tool for designers working within the Dynamic Framework. This plugin streamlines your design-to-development workflow with three core functionalities:Export CSS as Variables: Seamlessly export your design elements as CSS variables tailored for the Dynamic Framework. This feature ensures consistency and speeds up the handoff process, making it easier for developers to implement designs directly from Figma.Generate Color Palette: Effortlessly create and customize color palettes directly within Figma. This feature allows you to generate a range of colors that can be easily adjusted and applied across your design system, ensuring brand consistency and flexibility.Font Size Generator Based on PX: Simplify your typography management with a font size generator that operates based on pixel values. This allows for easy creation of a typographic scale that aligns with your design requirements, ensuring responsive and visually appealing text styles.The Modyo Figma Plugin is designed to empower designers and developers, making collaboration smoother and more efficient by providing a unified toolkit for creating consistent and high-quality UI components.
plugins.tagline: A plugin for Dynamic Framework

plugins.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
plugins.description: I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

135698.description: I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

plugins.name: Text Styles to Variables
plugins.description: PLUGIN CRAFTED FOR REFOKUSPlugin DocumentationThis plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:‚Ä¢Font size‚Ä¢Font weight‚Ä¢Font familyAdditionally, the plugin documents‚Äîbut does not apply‚Äîthe following properties:‚Ä¢Line height‚Ä¢Letter spacingThis is due to a current Figma limitation: dynamic variables for these properties are not yet supported. As a workaround, these values are stored as string variables for documentation purposes only.For example:If the original line-height is 100%, the plugin will store it as a variable with:variableName: 100%, variableValue: 1em (calculated as 100 √∑ 100 √ó 1em)Naming Convention for text styles:To ensure accurate detection and conversion, your text styles should follow this naming structure:‚Ä¢Use the prefix title- followed by a number (e.g., title-1) for headings‚Ä¢Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphsYou can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:‚Ä¢text-2-buttonLabelThis will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.
plugins.tagline: By Fede Luna

Customizable settings allow you to target specific text nodes, saving time on manual entry and bringing a smarter approach to data generation.

plugins.name: Text With Styles
plugins.description: # Flutter Text Style InspectorA powerful Figma plugin that bridges the gap between Figma text styles and Flutter's Material Design text theme system. This plugin helps developers and designers maintain consistency between Figma designs and Flutter implementations by automatically mapping Figma text styles to their corresponding Flutter TextTheme properties.## Features### Real-time Style Inspection- Instantly view text style information for any selected text layer- Live updates as you select different text elements- Support for multiple text selection with smart duplicate filtering### Comprehensive Style Information- Displays the complete Figma text style name- Shows associated color token information- Previews the actual text content- Automatically generates corresponding Flutter TextTheme code### Smart Flutter Code Generation- Automatically maps Figma text styles to Flutter's Material Design text theme- Supports all standard Material text styles:- Headlines (Large, Medium, Small)- Titles (Large, Medium, Small)- Body text (with weight variations)- Labels (Large, Medium, Small)- Includes font weight handling for body styles (w400, w500, w600)### User-Friendly Interface- Clean, organized display of style information- Easy-to-copy Flutter code snippets- Compact, floating UI that stays out of your way- Simple click-outside-to-close functionality## How to Use1. Select any text layer(s) in your Figma design2. The plugin will automatically display:- The applied Figma text style- The color token (if available)- A preview of the text content- The equivalent Flutter TextTheme code3. Copy the generated Flutter code directly into your application## Best Practices- Name your Figma text styles to match Material Design conventions for automatic mapping- Use consistent style names to ensure accurate Flutter code generation- Apply color styles to text layers for complete token information- Select multiple text layers to quickly inspect all text styles in a componentPerfect for teams working with both Figma and Flutter, this plugin streamlines the handoff process and ensures design consistency across platforms.
plugins.tagline: Select any layer and get its texts with styles

plugins.name: Variable Remapper
plugins.description: OVERVIEWThe Variable Remapper is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline design system management by enabling seamless migration and remapping of variables between different libraries and collections. This tool is essential for teams managing complex design systems, migrating between libraries, or consolidating variable usage across projects.CORE CAPABILITIESVariable RemappingThe plugin provides comprehensive bulk variable migration capabilities, automatically remapping variables from one library to another across entire design systems. The intelligent name matching system matches variables between source and target libraries based on name similarity, reducing manual configuration requirements.Users can exercise precise scope control by choosing to remap variables across selected objects only, the current page, or all pages in the document. Additionally, collection-specific remapping allows filtering to specific variable collections for granular control over migration processes.Variable Analysis and MappingThe system offers comprehensive variable listing functionality to scan and catalog all variable bindings throughout designs. The detailed view presents every variable binding with complete contextual information, including node names and types, bound properties such as fills, strokes, effects, and dimensions, current variable names and sources, plus complete library and collection information.The grouped view consolidates similar variable bindings for streamlined bulk management operations, while the interactive mapping table enables manual specification of target variables for precise control over remapping processes.Library ManagementThe plugin provides robust multi-library support, working seamlessly with local variables in current files, team library variables, and remote libraries. Automatic library detection identifies variable sources and displays comprehensive library information throughout the interface.Users can browse through variable collections with detailed counts and metadata, supported by real-time loading of library collections and variables for immediate access to current information.KEY FEATURESPrecision ControlThe plugin supports comprehensive property-level binding across all Figma variable binding types, including color variables for fills and strokes, dimension variables for width, height, corner radius, and stroke weight, effect variables for opacity, rotation, and positioning, and boolean variables for visibility controls.Advanced array property support handles complex bindings such as multiple fills or effects, while safe remapping functionality validates target variables before applying changes to ensure data integrity throughout the migration process.Advanced AnalysisThe binding discovery system automatically identifies all variable bindings across complex node hierarchies, providing complete visibility into variable usage patterns. Source attribution functionality shows exactly where each variable originates, whether from the current file, specific team library names, or remote libraries.Collection context displays variable collection names for improved organization and understanding of variable relationships throughout the design system.User ExperienceThe tabbed interface provides clean separation between remapping and analysis functions, enabling focused workflows for different use cases. Real-time feedback includes loading states, progress indicators, and detailed status messages to keep users informed throughout operations.Comprehensive error handling delivers actionable feedback when issues arise, while the modern user interface utilizes Figma-native styling with responsive design principles for seamless integration with existing workflows.USE CASESDesign System MigrationOrganizations can migrate from deprecated variable libraries to updated versions, consolidate multiple libraries into a single source of truth, and update variable references when reorganizing design systems. This capability is essential for maintaining consistency during design system evolution and reducing technical debt.Theme ManagementTeams can efficiently switch between light and dark theme variables, apply brand-specific variable sets across different product lines, and test various variable configurations during design exploration phases. This functionality supports rapid iteration and brand consistency maintenance.Cleanup and OptimizationThe plugin enables identification of unused or orphaned variable bindings, standardization of variable usage across teams, and comprehensive auditing of variable implementation across large-scale projects. These capabilities support design system hygiene and optimization efforts.Workflow AutomationOrganizations can batch update variable references during design system updates, streamline handoff processes between design and development teams, and maintain consistency across multiple Figma files. This automation reduces manual work and minimizes human error in variable management processes.
plugins.tagline: Streamline design system by bulk remapping variables across libraries, pages, and components.
